name: Geometric Scaling of Smallest Torsion (ST)
description: Investigating if the Smallest Torsion (ST) of hyperbolic manifolds follows a predictable scaling law related to volume V, supporting the Axion Suppression Model.

hypothesis.H0: Smallest Torsion ln(ST) is stochastically distributed and independent of Hyperbolic Volume V (R² < 0.5).
hypothesis.H1: Smallest Torsion ln(ST) follows a scaling law ln(ST) = alpha * V + beta (or GPR equivalent) with R² >= 0.75.

data_requirements.description: Hyperbolic volume and torsion data from KnotInfo/LinkInfo and SSOT constants.

test_method: Gaussian Process Regression (GPR) and Linear Regression analysis comparing ln(ST) vs Volume V across 3-12 crossing knots.
